NMR are likely to give a high value to the benefit observed in NMR following chlorhexidine 
application to the cord. Interference with other essential newborn care practices, such as 
skin-to-skin care and early initiation of breastfeeding, may be a concern if chlorhexidine 
application is done in the first hour after birth.
Costs: Chlorhexidine solution is not expensive; it can be made available in even resource-
restricted settings.
